wines.description: A 2023 wine from California, showcasing bold fruit character and structured tannins. This wine represents quality winemaking and terroir expression, offering exceptional drinking pleasure.

tastingNotes.aroma: The bouquet reveals concentrated aromas of plum and cassis, complemented by notes of clove and graphite. Additional layers of cedar and oak-derived truffle add complexity. The nose is intense yet refined, showing excellent concentration.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, flavors of blackcurrant and blueberry dominate, supported by well-integrated tannins. The mid-palate reveals vanilla, forest floor, and subtle oak. Balanced acidity provides freshness while the texture is smooth and velvety. The wine shows impressive depth and complexity.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and persistent, with black raspberry flavors lingering alongside nutmeg. Refined tannins suggest good aging potential. The aftertaste is memorable and complex.

foodPairings: Grilled ribeye steak with herb butter
Braised short ribs in wine reduction

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 30-60 minutes to open aromatics

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030; can age 5-10 years

wines.description: A 2018 wine from California, showcasing refreshing fruit and elegant balance. This wine represents quality winemaking and terroir expression, offering exceptional drinking pleasure.

tastingNotes.aroma: Delicate aromas of strawberry and raspberry open the bouquet, with subtle floral notes. Fresh and inviting aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: Bright red berry flavors balanced by crisp acidity. Refreshing and food-friendly with elegant texture.
tastingNotes.finish: Clean, crisp finish with lingering red berry notes. Perfect for warm weather.

wines.productName: Casa Dumetz Clementine Carter Santa Rita Hills Grenache 2023
wines.description: A 2023 wine from California, showcasing bold fruit character and structured tannins. This wine represents quality winemaking and terroir expression, offering exceptional drinking pleasure.

tastingNotes.aroma: The bouquet reveals concentrated aromas of blackcurrant and blueberry, complemented by notes of cedar and forest floor. Additional layers of star anise and oak-derived cocoa add complexity. The nose is intense yet refined, showing excellent concentration.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, flavors of black raspberry and blackberry dominate, supported by well-integrated tannins. The mid-palate reveals nutmeg, espresso, and subtle oak. Balanced acidity provides freshness while the texture is smooth and velvety. The wine shows impressive depth and complexity.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and persistent, with dark cherry flavors lingering alongside black pepper. Refined tannins suggest good aging potential. The aftertaste is memorable and complex.

wines.description: A 2021 wine from California, showcasing bold fruit character and structured tannins. This wine represents quality winemaking and terroir expression, offering exceptional drinking pleasure.

tastingNotes.aroma: The bouquet reveals concentrated aromas of blueberry and black raspberry, complemented by notes of nutmeg and cocoa. Additional layers of black pepper and oak-derived espresso add complexity. The nose is intense yet refined, showing excellent concentration.
tastingNotes.palate: On the palate, flavors of blackberry and dark cherry dominate, supported by well-integrated tannins. The mid-palate reveals star anise, leather, and subtle oak. Balanced acidity provides freshness while the texture is smooth and velvety. The wine shows impressive depth and complexity.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish is long and persistent, with plum flavors lingering alongside cinnamon. Refined tannins suggest good aging potential. The aftertaste is memorable and complex.

wines.description: A 2018 wine from California, showcasing crisp acidity and vibrant aromatics. This wine represents quality winemaking and terroir expression, offering exceptional drinking pleasure.

tastingNotes.aroma: Bright aromas of citrus and green apple lead the nose, accented by white flowers. Underlying wet stone adds terroir complexity. The profile is fresh, vibrant, and inviting.
tastingNotes.palate: Crisp acidity provides excellent structure, supporting flavors of pear, white peach, and melon. The mid-palate shows honeysuckle and subtle flint. Medium-bodied with good concentration and balance.
tastingNotes.finish: Clean and persistent finish with citrus and mineral notes. Bright acidity leaves the palate refreshed. Excellent length and purity.

foodPairings: Fresh oysters on the half shell

wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2026; best enjoyed young
